title.narrative: Building Capacities of Small-Medium Forest Enterprises (SMFEs) in Ghana and Liberia to Supply and Trade in Legal Timber - Phase II

description.narrative: The project seeks to consolidate efforts on building the capacity of timber companies to be able to comply with FLEGT requirements. The project is targeted at Small and Medium Timber Enterprises (SMFEs) in Ghana and Liberia. While recognizing the power of industry to affect the integrity of forests, local demand for illegal timber further increased deforestation. Giving the importance of gender in the sector, project activities are designed not only to be gender-sensitive but also gender-responsive. Dedicated activities to give voice to women in the sector are also being be implemented.

participating-org.narrative: Liberia Chainsaw and Timber Dealers Union

activity-date.narrative: Technically, the project started on 1st April 2021.

mailing-address.narrative: Center for African Wetlands Building University of Ghana - Legon PMB L45 Accra-Ghana

recipient-country.narrative: Seventy-six per cent of the total grant is towards project activities in Ghana
Twenty-four per cent of the total grant is toward activities in Liberia.

sector.narrative: NDF is a national environmental NGO that works in the forests and the agricultural sector.

description.narrative: Funds received for project activities for quarter one of project year one (Q1Y1).

provider-org.narrative: Forest Governance Market and Trade Programme Extension Grants Round (2021-2023)

receiver-org.narrative: A modest national NGO working in Ghana with partners across Africa

description.narrative: NDF expenditure on the project for quarter four of project year one (PY1Q4)

provider-org.narrative: The Government of the United Kingdom Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office.

receiver-org.narrative: Nature and Development Organization (NDF). A modest non-governmental organization in Ghana with partners across West Africa. NDF is a grantee of the FGMC programme.
